alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Northwest Highlands; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 01 at 2:38AM MST until January 01 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches, except 12 to 20 inches above 9,000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph creating areas of reduced visibilities in blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Northwest Highlands, Chuska Mountains, West Central Mountains and West Central Plateau. * WHEN...Until Noon MST today. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. These hazardous conditions will impact the holiday travel period.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Northwest Highlands; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
